name: bigdumbtravface
text: A comment left by bigdumbtravface was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by diggydow, eddylee, Archon_Divinus)

name: vweep
text: So close... yet so far away...

name: closefriend
text: Is that Pat or Beef playing Cheney? Because I could really see Pat as the CEO of Halliburton.

name: teteae
text: Yeah pretty sure it's pat

name: juancarlos
text:
No way, it's Roast Beef

a) The achewood theatre consists of T and Beef.

b) Pat is too much of an asshole to play along with T's ridiculous sketch.

c)He just looks more like Beef, of course that's just my perception of things.

And yeah, third panel is all true.

In 1986, Cheney, along with 145 Republicans and 31 Democrats, voted against a nonbinding Congressional resolution calling on the South African government to release Nelson Mandela from prison, after the majority Democrats defeated proposed amendments to the language that would have required Mandela to renounce violence sponsored by the ANC and requiring the ANC to oust the Communist faction from leadership.

name: nigelchaos
text:
Wow.
"It's great to learn! 'Cuz knowledge is power!"

name: baryonyx
text:
And KNOWING IS HALF THE BATTLE.

(Incidentally, I believe the other half is 'violence'.)

name: belgand
text: Violence that fails to result in injuries that is.

name: boboctiberius
text: You commented on this 10 months late, and didn't say anything about the avatar text synergy? Shame.

name: ih8jonmayr
text: G.I. JOOOEEEE!!!

name: nigelchaos
text: HELP COMPUTER

text:
KNOWLEDGE BRINGS FEAR

(Inscription on the gate of Mars University in Futurama)

name: jonmw
text: What else did that particular resolution include?

name: wonelove
text: seconded.

name: belgand
text: Free Nelson Rockefeller!! Attica! Attica! Attica!

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Quote:
In 1986, Cheney, along with 145 Republicans and 31 Democrats, voted against a nonbinding Congressional resolution calling on the South African government to release Nelson Mandela from prison, after the majority Democrats defeated proposed amendments to the language that would have required Mandela to renounce violence sponsored by the ANC and requiring the ANC to oust the Communist faction from leadership.


[b]BOO TO THAT![/]b

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
dang it.
BOO TO THAT!

is what I meant

name: shutup_shutup
text: wow, somehow my brain totally wanted that to say " BOOT THAT UP ". I wish I knew why.

name: carlyle
text:
It looks like the ice cream man.

They probably dragged him from his shop and sat him in a chair, waiting for him to fall asleep. Then they dressed him in Cheney clothes and did the scene very quietly before dragging him back to the shoppe.

text: Cheney's heart stopped momentarily between panel three and five.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Then his undying anger towards progress revived him in the last panel.

name: tpederson
text: Anyone who's tried to manually assemble the pins for a USB front panel connection would also vote against it.  Damn these giant sasauge hands.

name: hendetta
text: Teodor is most assuredly dashing enough to be Edwards.

name: presterjohn
text:
'dashing' is not so much my first impression of Edwards.
'Oh dogg is it time to buy a car again' would be closer to the mark.

text: ahh. cheney did vote against those things.

name: audhumla
text: to be fair those phones are pretty swell

name: lamewad
text:
"...By means of a curly wire."
Hah!

name: sp1derbaby
text: The wire must be curly as God intended, not straightened by heathen scientists.

name: rowboat
text: I would vote yes on that last bill. I used to think I'd get over it, but it is becoming apparent to me that I will forever be distrustful of cell phones and their users. I am old before my time.

name: greenkoolayd
text: how do you feel about cordless house phones?

name: rowboat
text: They can do whatever they want behind closed doors as long as they're not trying to recruit my kids.

name: greenkoolayd
text: mighty white of you.

name: aelindil
text: I really like what is going on in this here thread.  Yes I do.

name: slalvation
text: I have strong positive feelings towards telephones with the curly wires.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Pat: Chinese people are keeping secrets from us.
Philippe: Gross!
Molly: Moving = not so easy
Onstad: I cleaned the area to the left of my desk
Nice Pete: Chapter 8

(It's just Lee Kum Kee and cornstarch, Pat. Also: the boyfriend tells of a restaurant he went to where the Secret Chinese-Only Menu was actually painted on the wall, appearing to English-speaking patrons as a mere "pretty Chinese characters" type of decoration. Wily!)

name: mysterymeat1001
text: What an awesome place for a secret menu!

name: heccibiggs
text: That is wily! I'm going to take my Chinese friend with me whenever I to to a Chinese restaurant now and have her be on the lookout.

name: sleepyhead
text: man, voting against nets for public school basketball hoops is just plain wrong

name: sp1derbaby
text: He finds the fwhoosh! sound to be homo-suggestive.

name: edwell
text:
Excerpt from the actual Cheney-Edwards debate, which was broadcast the night before this strip ran:

JOHN EDWARDS: When he was one of 435 members of the United States House, he was one of 10 to vote against Head Start, one of four to vote against banning plastic weapons that can pass through metal detectors. He voted against the Department of Education. He voted against funding for Meals on Wheels for seniors. He voted against a holiday for Martin Luther King. He voted against a resolution calling for the release of Nelson Mandela in South Africa. It's amazing to hear him criticizing either my record or John Kerry's.

MODERATOR: Thirty seconds.

DICK CHENEY: Oh, I think his record speaks for itself and, frankly, it's not very distinguished.

MODERATOR: In that case, we'll move on to domestic matters...

name: extortshorties
text: That freaks me out. Thank God he's leaving.

name: mikestan
text:
Ironically enough, he did NOT vote for a bill saying it was okay to shoot people in the face...

He just did it anyway.

name: greenkoolayd
text: if theres no rule, then its ok.
